title: Failed to load URL "https://riot:c0BQUu1OihlnftKtO0u1BQ@127.0.0.1:49502/index.html" with error
body: This has been happening for a week now, but every time I try to open my League client, this pops up and says "Failed to load URL "https://riot:c0BQUu1OihlnftKtO0u1BQ@127.0.0.1:49502/index.html" with error "unknown error code -130" (-130)." Please help.

replies.body: Hey I just got the same message today, seems like a recent bug. Do we reinstall the game?

Hey Guys, I found the solution in my case. It has nothing to do with the client or riot, this is caused by a spyware in your computer that changes your proxy server, what you want to do is open your > internet options, then click on the "Connections" tab > Then click on  "LAN Settings" and under "Proxy Server" uncheck the box that says "Use a proxy server for ......" 

This is the steps for Windows 10 and Windows 7, Windows 8 and 8.1 may vary.

Hopefully this work for you.
Do you by any chance know how to remove the spyware or from where it might've come?

Hey there,

Could you try [running a client repair](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes#wq6) for me, let me know if this helps.
